composers.name: Hildegard von Bingen
composers.characteristics: Monophonic (single melody), modal scales, sacred chant
composers.significance: Defined sacred monophony

composers.name: Léonin
composers.characteristics: Organum, first notated polyphony, Notre Dame school
composers.significance: Invented organum — first polyphony

composers.name: Guillaume de Machaut
composers.characteristics: Ars Nova, early polyphony, secular songs
composers.significance: First complete polyphonic mass; bridged sacred and secular

composers.name: Josquin des Prez
composers.characteristics: Polyphony, imitative counterpoint, text expression
composers.significance: Music begins expressing specific emotions and text meaning

composers.name: Giovanni Pierluigi da Palestrina
composers.characteristics: Smooth polyphony, perfect voice leading, Counter-Reformation ideal
composers.significance: Perfected sacred polyphony; model for centuries of church music

composers.name: Claudio Monteverdi
composers.characteristics: Seconda pratica, text-driven harmony, dramatic expression
composers.significance: Invented opera; bridged Renaissance to Baroque

composers.name: Johann Sebastian Bach
composers.characteristics: Functional harmony, counterpoint mastery, figured bass, ornamentation
composers.significance: Mastered counterpoint and tonal system; polyphonic zenith

composers.name: George Frideric Handel
composers.characteristics: Italian opera, English oratorio, grand ceremonial style
composers.significance: Popularized oratorio; made classical music public entertainment

composers.name: Antonio Vivaldi
composers.characteristics: Ritornello form, virtuosic solo writing, programmatic music
composers.significance: Pioneered the concerto form; influenced Bach and all who followed

composers.name: Joseph Haydn
composers.characteristics: Symphony/string quartet father, sonata form, wit and surprise
composers.significance: Invented the symphony and string quartet as premier forms

composers.name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
composers.characteristics: Clarity, balance, elegant forms, transparent textures
composers.significance: Perfected symphony, concerto, opera; melody-harmony balance

composers.name: Carl Philipp Emanuel Bach
composers.characteristics: Empfindsamer Stil, emotional contrast, free fantasy
composers.significance: Broke from Baroque rigidity; emotional style that shaped Haydn and Mozart

composers.name: Ludwig van Beethoven
composers.characteristics: Motivic development, expanded forms, personal expression, drama
composers.significance: Transformed music into profound personal and universal expression

composers.name: Richard Wagner
composers.characteristics: Leitmotif, Gesamtkunstwerk, chromatic harmony, endless melody
composers.significance: Dissolved tonality; Tristan chord changed harmony forever

composers.name: Frédéric Chopin
composers.characteristics: Individual emotion, nationalism, piano revolution, ornamentation
composers.significance: Revolutionized piano idiom; intimate emotional expression

composers.name: Franz Liszt
composers.characteristics: Virtuosity, symphonic poem, thematic transformation, showmanship
composers.significance: Invented the solo recital and symphonic poem

transition: Abandoned German logic → Color and atmosphere

composers.name: Claude Debussy
composers.characteristics: Color over form, ambiguous tonality, whole-tone/pentatonic scales, atmosphere
composers.significance: Abandoned tonal rules; created entirely new color palette

composers.name: Maurice Ravel
composers.characteristics: Exquisite orchestration, jazz influences, precision with sensuality
composers.significance: Master orchestrator; orchestration itself as composition

composers.name: Erik Satie
composers.characteristics: Simplicity, anti-Romantic, furniture music, proto-minimalism
composers.significance: Minimalist precursor; anti-Romantic rebel who influenced Debussy and Cage

composers.name: Igor Stravinsky
composers.characteristics: Rhythmic innovation, primitivism, bitonality, neoclassicism
composers.significance: Showed rhythm could be as revolutionary as harmony

composers.name: Arnold Schoenberg
composers.characteristics: Atonality, twelve-tone technique, expressionism, abandons key centers
composers.significance: Abandoned tonality entirely; created the twelve-tone system

composers.name: Béla Bartók
composers.characteristics: Folk music research, dissonance, asymmetric rhythms, night music

piece.title: Music for Strings, Percussion and Celesta

composers.significance: Fused folk authenticity with modernist language

composers.name: Olivier Messiaen
composers.characteristics: Modes of limited transposition, birdsong, rhythmic innovation, synesthesia

piece.title: Quartet for the End of Time

composers.significance: New modes, birdsong as music; taught Boulez and Stockhausen

composers.name: John Cage
composers.characteristics: Chance operations, prepared piano, silence as music, conceptualism
composers.significance: Redefined what music is; any sound (or none) can be music

composers.name: Philip Glass
composers.characteristics: Repetition, gradual transformation, return to tonality, accessibility
composers.significance: Minimalism; reconnected classical music with popular audiences

composers.name: Steve Reich
composers.characteristics: Phasing, process music, rhythmic patterns, speech melody
composers.significance: Invented phasing and process music; rhythm as structure

composers.name: Kaija Saariaho
composers.characteristics: Spectral music, tone color focus, electronics, pluralism, global influences
composers.significance: Spectral music; fused electronics with acoustic instruments
